PHP1fovDlwUFMbdzcAwRKQ.text: I was staring greedily at the menu just 4 days ago when I was here and today I finally tried their Spiced Chai Latte (Christmas Special Drink) and Waffles with Rum&Raisin ice cream.Despite having an up-sized Bak Chor Mee dinner earlier, we finished the waffle in record time. Freshly-made piping-hot waffles with rum&raisin ice cream is heavenly - a definite must try.I'm used to a much heavy taste of Spiced Chai Latte so I was surprised that this was pretty light on the taste buds. Significantly missing was the taste of cinnamon which only came as an aftertaste that was barely there. Well, the drink grows on you I guess as I felt quite satisfied after I finished my cup.Absolutely love the fact that its a closely-knit family-run business. The cafe was empty save for the staff/family at 730pm but started to fill up pretty quickly from 745pm onwards!Will be back again... this weekend perhaps!Don't recommend this to your friends, let's keep this a secret shall we?

photos.caption: Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. Waffle with rum and raisin ice cream
Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. Spiced chai latte-Christmas special drink. Lacks cinnamon though.

TA0s7chesYL8dqWHT92t_g.text: Glad I took the recommendation from them to try their pandan pancake. And the waffles with egg, bacon and scrambled egg was heavenly. Loved the scrambled egg especially!

TE3NRZhwx5NLhPScrpR-qQ.text: Coffee is good. Nice atmosphere. Good food. Only accepts cash or NETS so travellers beware. Reminds me of a typical Melbourne, Australia cafe.

7aSjFehW0L7gmvkraNjr8A.text: Eating in Tolido's is a great opportunity for people who love breakfast and pastas. The food looks very presentable and the taste is oustandingly perfect. If any of you are breakfast and pasta fans or even either one, come to Tolido!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. Ultimate combo is the real deal peps
Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. Enjoying Mac n cheese
Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. Delicious walffle slammer

qBCh4dv6n4tbMGSAOWyAkg.text: Excellent food. They understand what real Western breakfast food is. The maple syrup is potent; the pancake is eggy and fluffy; the coffee is good, but a but sour. It's a great place to get your early morning fuel.

w_zKPdRcvbPvxLUv1oxm1A.text: The coffee is good, really good. But under no circumstances is it appropriate to wait 30 minutes for a coffee. We ordered, received our food. I went to the counter after 15 minutes to confirm they remembered our coffees. Food now finished. Someone comes over to confirm our coffee order and we repeat our order. 15 more minutes we receive a coffee. This place has great potential, but great coffee without great service makes for an average experience.

Y72b84FTBruee7yg-GMcWw.text: Cheap and easy. Food was good and came quick. If I'm in the neighborhood, I'll definitely come back.

WdMGyuyKNBVVgcv6EIPZvQ.text: Love this place! One of the few brunch places in Singapore where you can get some decently priced grubs! Food is good too!

vlHta4h1jYOEj8urha02_g.text: Best long black i've had in Singapore, Thailand, or Malaysia. Was there for breakfast/brunch, pancakes and french toast were very tasty and well priced. Good atmosphere and a bit of a hipster fit-out (thats a positive - has a bit of character).

46xjy_7_o6VdarAyFquqiQ.text: Ice blended sea salt caramel latte was great (but not so much when it's hot). Smoked salmon carbonara didn't quite work. The Ultimate pancakes and bacon were good separately but as a whole, the dish didn't make an impression. Service is excellent, staff were friendly and accommodating.

0RUDSrsHFuh12mI7l9jYxA.text: Good vibe, good food. Came here based on yelp reviews for breakfast. My husband ordered pancakes and the pumpkin spice latte. He really enjoyed his meal, which is a plus. I ordered the laksa prawn noodle as I wanted to try what locals love to eat. It was good, but probably not my favorite flavor. Staff is nice here and the restaurant is a nice place to relax and have a wonderful time. Worth a visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. Prawn laksa noodle

TIkXJDfay9s83o4VOA5PcA.text: Another hipster cafe? Great. There aren't enough of them to go round this little island :)The food is generally tasty - standard fare that you would expect from a regular hipster cafe. Likewise for decor - it may not necessary "wow" you but it certainly isn't poorly done up. Would I recommend it? Yes, if you happen to be in the neighborhood.

photos.caption: Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. Tolido's.

SojDUSzydKKvGgpX4Rtbzg.text: Great little cafe! One of our favorite spots during our trip to Singapore. Great food, atmosphere and coffee!

P3ikgClIzB0zpJqrS0C7DA.text: First time here. Good vibes hit me as soon as I  walked thru the doors... "hmmm good start" I thought to myself :) Super friendly and happy staff - checkedTasty yummy food - checkedAwesome coffee - checkedAffordable prices - checkedFairly accessible - checked (either 5-10mins walk from Lavender mrt or park at nearby hdb parking lots behind)Had the croissant with scrambled eggs and streaky bacon, rosti with sunny side egg and bratwurst (recommended by staff), pandan pancakes with vanilla ice cream and gula melaka sauce *hhhhhhhnnnn* few cuppa flat whites..Walked out with a happy tummy and a smile on my face. Kudos, Tolido's! I'll be back for sure :D

photos.caption: Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. cereal bacon rolls ~~ yummm!
Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. squid ink pasta
Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. whatchu wanna drink?

9yEr0FV_1CwWDe8a0z4v9w.text: I'm so happy to find so many cozy cafes popping up around the island, and it's always heartening to see local spins on usual brunch items.The one thing that stood out to me on the menu was an SG50 special - pandan pancakes! Don't expect it to be like a pandan chiffon cake (because duh it's a pancake), but they were still delightfully fluffy and I easily downed the whole plate of three.They currently have pineapple waffles for CNY, and I would be back to try if I have the time.One star off for the rather overwhelming truffle oil smell that hits you when you walk in - I like them truffle fries, but don't really want to smell like one.

photos.caption: Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. Pandan pancakes (bottom)

16MP6RHDUZcxC5aKqvsJPQ.text: I liked the Gula Melaka pancake. For local tastebuds, that's the bomb. Sadly, service was a huge disappointment. Person taking orders was abit rude and unable to customise orders ( like adding cheese to egg, was like super challenging) and he doesn't know the ingredients well so was clueless most of the time. It feels like mostly a student hangout place. Coffee is not bad.

gNhX0tf5qKdjXsJglO_uFg.text: Pro:- Food is delicious- French toast is amazing! But to small (more bacon)- ultimate combo is tasty and good amount of food Con:- Portion size between plates varies to much - Smoke salmon not worth the cost. Flavor is ok but nothing amazing- Service is terrible, they bring u food but no utensils. If u ask them for something don't expect them to remember. - Seating is poorly done. It's a mixture of first come first serve, reservation, and who ever tells the guy walking around where they want to sit.

mHejoRk82MqUUdGE3TelMA.text: I have to admit this place wasn't the easiest to find but the food is good and it comes out very quick after you order even when it's a full house! We ordered the tolido pancakes and 3 egg omelette. The bacon was so good! Need more of that! The pancakes are so light and fluffy! Def a treat for me! The 3Egg omelettes are also very fluffy and almost liquidy on the inside!Update 26th sept 2014: so now that it's my 3rd time here. I decided to try the ultimate combo and it's delicious! The bacon smelt so good, it would make anyone hungry! The pancakes were just as good.. They may look like normal pancakes but just wait till you put them into your mouth! It's so fluffy and tasty!! The Rosti with cheese sausages for $12.90 is a good price and the Rosti is delish! I did have to tell them to cook with less oil as the last time I had it. My plate was flooded with a layer of oil...  I need to visit here more often to checkout more menu items like the cereal bacon! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. My favourite cookies n cream gelato waffle!!! :)
Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. I'm finally here to try their latte!! :)

r-1y14XlHxYABo7WtmrlqA.text: Loved it! You have to get the sea salt caramel latte blended- it's better than Starbucks! Great food: had pancakes/eggs/cheese sausage one morning and potatoes/eggs/cheese sausage the next day! This place is a must if you want to brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. Sea salt caramel latte blended! Delicious!!!

NQRdKSaiI4qyj4TNkbtLEQ.text: Been hearing all the raving about this place from a bunch and friends and I FINALLY got to visit today and it didnt disappoint. While small, it's not too noisy even when crowded. So I guess the crowd are pretty refined (albeit young). They serve up Yahava Koffee here so fans of Yahava KoffeeWorks can enjoy a nice cuppa here though they wont have the full Yahava selection here. I'm really not a coffee person so am just happy to settle with a nice cup of fragrant Chai Latte. Didnt had too much time to try the mains but I managed to grab a bite of their plain pancakes. It's a little pricey at $6 for 3 plain pancakes only, at $7 or more, you could try their Banana Pancakes or the Tolido Pancakes that comes with sausages. The pancakes are soft and fluffy, nice texture but still lacks a little bit of the richness compared to those that you'll get at McDs.They have breakfast all day menu and pasta mains. Simple cafe with a good variety. Staff are really friendly and nice. Would not hesitate to go back to try more food from their menu soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. Tolido Pancakes!
Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. Hot chocolate
Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. Waffle Ice Cream!

0216iwrruriPRrYExtXFcg.text: Of the 'Hdb neighborhood cafes' that I've visited, Tolido's Espresso Nook is one that left an impression (a good one). Tucked in chaotic Crawford Lane among local coffee shops and singlet-wearing ah peks, and aunties hawking random stuff at void decks, this cafe juxtaposes with a relaxed and chic vibe that would warrant a repeat visit. I love the fluidity in the different spaces, loosely separated by the low coffee bar and the floor to ceiling glass panes that act as invisible barriers to the alfresco area. All-day breakfast is served here for all you breakfast eaters! Pancakes, eggs, toast, waffles and small pastries are available all day err day and there's no need to wait for the weekends. I decided not to be greedy and went with the Tolido's Pancakes ($9.90) which comes with 2 fluffy pancakes, streaky bacon and egg (sunnyside up). Typically, the greedy me would have ordered the Ultimate Combo ($11.50) which includes 2 chipolata sausages, and more eggs, on top of the basic pancakes but well it's quite a substantial portion already. The pancakes, while fluffy, were still kinda moist and sticky inside. A distinct milky flavor could be tasted and I liked that the batter was slightly salty. I topped up $2 for scrambled eggs instead of a sunny side up. The eggs had a nice height to it and was poofy like a cloud. It could be a little more funny but it was still decent.S had the Waffle with Ice Cream ($10.50) which came with a choice of a single scoop of ice cream, sprinkled with freshly baked crumble and drizzled with your choice of sauce on a thick waffle. If you like a crunchy waffles, this would be up your alley but I thought it was a little more like a biscuit i.e. dry.  The generic but sufficiently rich chocolate ice cream helped to moisten the batter a little but did not make the dish spectacular. If you want something more substantial, Tolido's also does pastas and sandwiches at reasonable prices ($10.50 onwards). I would love to try the Croque Monsieur, only because i love the french ham and cheese sandwich. Now now, Tolido's also serves really good and pretty coffee. Yahava coffee blends are used here and the medium roast was fragrant and smooth with a low acidity. Head barista and owner Douglas Tan was the third place winner in the 2014 Singapore Latte Art Competition and that explains the photogenic cuppas.Do not miss the Salted caramel latte. The flavor was well blended into the drink and every sip was a velvety mouthful with the perfect amount of salt. Yums. Adding to my list of favorites because of their salted caramel latte and lovely space!

K7u94qSj__x_riwMVoCDlA.text: Their food is so delicious here. Everyone in my group (7 people including young kids) all loved their food. Their coffee is really delicious as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. When craving western breakfast go to Tolido's! Plus they've got REALLY great coffee  #Singapore

IKs5b8PLCkB3h3FY311XkQ.text: Oh, so delicious! So glad we found this place, with wonderful breakfast specials to go with their extraordinary brewed offerings. Would be very difficult to choose which dish I liked the most, but I think I'd go with the pandan pancakes, which were perfectly prepared and the pandan adds a wonderful touch. Would not go to Singapore without visiting this place.

Fo7fj6RmG2mRSscFq9KA6w.text: My friend has been telling me about their pandan pancakes for a while, so after lunch at Kampong Glam we decided to get some dessert and coffee at Tolido. It was still buzzing with the lunch crowd but emptied out pretty soon after  1.30. My stack of three Pandan pancakes were good. Fluffy with a whiff of pandan, they were great with the ice-cream and Gula Melaka drizzle. I had the perfect Salted Caramel Latte too- smooth, milky, and rich enough to leave you wanting. I like that unlike some cafes, they have their act together - AND the staff are smiling. Win. (And TIP if you're impressed ok. That's how we spread the love!)

photos.caption: Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. Pandan Pancakes and Salted Caramel Latte- great enough to make me battle the line to the carpark!

41VXId1YmMvHjZeeHYdoOg.text: If your from the states like I am and looking to take a break from the local hawker stand and looking for alittle taste of back home; this is definitely a place to check out. The staff are awesome and they really make you feel at home. Definitely try the milk shake even for breakfast; with the Singapore heat wave, this delectable frost of goodness just make the meal complete.

RZQFlZiOh2zti-oRrSJd8g.text: People are nice, tap water is for free, The cold low fat chocolate was great and the banana pan cakes I had were the best ever! They just don't get full points because I were missing one savory vegeterian solution on the menue such as avocado smash...

photos.caption: Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. What people see passing by
Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. The view
Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. View over fresh pressed orange juice and cold chocolate

JatIcDobv0zyr3q7w_n3BQ.text: Fine way to eat breakfast western style. Its really cheap in terms of singapore prices :) we eat some pancakes and scrambled eggs which were good!

UH6MA4DkkBHgcs7HFoF_Jg.text: Love, love, love Tolido! Who can't resist a charming neighborhood hangout that boasts a top-notch Barista and a kitchen that can whip up a seriously good breakfast meal (not to mention an assortment of pastas).I went here with my wife for our usual Sunday brunch where we normally try to recover from a night of going out by eating a filling breakfast. I ordered the Banana Pancakes (Yum!) while my wife ordered the French Toast (Double Yum!). What stood out to me was not just the great taste and the beautiful presentation, but rather the intangibles. Specifically, the soul and love that was put into each dish and each cup of coffee made for that matter. It definitely brought me back to that feeling when my parents used to serve me banana pancakes when I was a young boy. So much can be said of Tolido, but I'll some it up by these select adjectives: welcoming, charming, neighborly, pleasant, and cozy. Did I mention the All Day Breakfast!!! Count me in! Kudos to Douglas for introducing himself to my wife and I and making us feel at home.

photos.caption: Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. French Toast!
Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. Banana Pancakes!
Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. Flat White Coffee!

GDrYbHORmhWCVATyuQe3YQ.text: Oh yeah! Another hipster like coffee shop in SG... Exciting, ehrm, not so much :( Ordered scrambled eggs with croissant and bacon. Eggs came in over buttered and nothing special, no cheese in them or any other additional ingredient. Menu misses yoghurt or muesli for breakfast... Waited 25 mins for a coffee, they forgot about our order. It seems as if the place was ran by some young punks that lack order. There's about 3 waiters they Kept coming asking what we ordered. Not only is but the table next to us as well. the coffee is actually good! Bitter than smooth but the fluffy milk balances out the Flavours well.Inside is too crowded and small for my liking and disorganised. Especially at the entrance where water filler is placed and tables, can't get through... I might be back but only because it's close to my house. Rating three only because of the coffee else this would get two... p.S. For those that rated this 4 please go to Ronin.... Stay true to yelp!

hLsTJhv01qDD4GJ9e5xE3A.text: Loved the coffee and brunch selection! Best beef bolognese and baked eggs! Best spiced chai latte ever!  I travel from Orchard to here every weekend since I've discovered the place! Loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. Strip sirloin roasted beef
Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. Sea salt spiced chai latte
Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. Salmon Carbonara

nRRa7fMtYyReny9hY31ylg.text: If I lived here I'd go to Tolido's every week. It's the right way to start your morning. They seat you with the menu and you place your order + pay at the front.With a ton of breakfast, caffeine, and non caffeine options, it took me a while to finally decide. I needed my morning fix of caffeine so I played it safe and got the americano. Bro got the iced peppermint mocha. For food, we got the ultimate combo and the truffle scrambled eggs.Drinks came quickly within 5 minutes. The americano was strong and awesome, just what I needed to start my day. Bro's iced peppermint mocha was amazing too. I'm typically not a fan of those fancy iced capp type drinks, but it was really good!!Bro's ultimate combo arrived first, and my scrambled eggs came few minutes after. The cheesey scrambled eggs with few chunks of veggies and strong taste of truffle was to die for. Every bite tasted like I needed another bite. The toast was decent but I didnt eat much. The salad was very lightly dressed, really appreciated that. The potatoes in the corner were not deep fried - really helping with my eat-healthy diet here!The servers here were all super polite and nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. Truffle scrambled eggs
Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. Inside of the restaurant
Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. Cute menus

tYO10Vc9OrTTOy5w__FNiw.text: Tolido's is a nice escape from the heat, and an intimate setting with incredible food. If I spent more time in Singapore, I would definitely become a regular.To start, the pandan waffles are just amazing. An incredible blend of pandan topped with coconut ice cream... But of course, I couldn't just stop there! I decided to go all out and also ordered the truffle eggs. A combination I wouldn't have thought of on my own, but it couldn't have been more perfect. I still dream about the food here... Amazingly delicious.

zTAVbtcuFUplmBJfJBXk8g.text: Double shot coffee at a much lower price than Starbucks and with a wonderful latte art!!??  I say kudos to the owner as passion for good coffee shows.  Service was also efficient and food wonderful.  Only thing is you got to be patient for the wait as good things come to those who waits :).

QKBSX3SF-kLkr9Fg0DEQlw.text: Prawns for breakfast? Sure, why not? This is a cute place to have both Singapore based food and the American breakfast---both utterly crucial to WHERE me and my boyfriend were going to eat (he wanted American vs I wanted Singapore food). Tolido's came to the rescue! Although the walk was a bit of a hike from where we were staying (Bugis shopping mall area), it was worth the walk. The service was spot on and the wait wasn't too terrible. Granted, I still recommend making reservations if you want a spot inside! It can get pretty busy otherwise.

photos.caption: Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore

NcDYNvnQMZoAL-VQolnWGg.text: I've only tried their blended matcha latte and I must say, it was the best matcha drink I've ever tasted. Will definitely come back to try more of their food and drinks!

photos.caption: Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. Blended matcha latte for around $6
Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore

vDIFziSnXj4yS-SnrtREoA.text: Tolido's Espresso Nook is a great little breakfast place.Tolido's is a cute little place in Singapore that, while not particularly convenient, is definitely worth walking over to.  Neither the coffee nor the sweet breakfast is the best I've ever had, but both were definitely pretty solid, and service was appropriately quick.  It's hard to complain in that regard - I got in, had a good breakfast, and got out in less than 30 minutes!

_5vPM-muXky1Ybdjdfjn0g.text: By far my new favorite breakfast spot in Singapore. Reasonable prices (for Singapore), great food, friendly staff, and an all day hip vibe. We'll be back tomorrow.

CgSuikqlI5xzMUogKnoS0A.text: One of our finds for Sunday brunches. Good coffee and all day breakfast. The sea salt caramel latte was heavenly. Cafe had a nice relaxed vibe.

photos.caption: Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. Rosti!
Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. Sea salt caramel latte ice blended. Very yummy
Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. Smoked salmon with scrambled eggs

HNNFCIRsBWO8Si-R5Cc3gg.text: We've been here twice now.  Definitely make a reservation and sit inside unless you're just looking for a quick coffee.  The food is unbelievably good here.  I highly recommend the Pandan pancakes!

photos.caption: Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore

rqKz1qPR5aM7v-eD7PWU6A.text: I LOVE the banana pancakes they serve. They have some nice caramelization on the bananas, whip cream, and drizzled caramel sauce to ensure you get some sweet and salty on each bite. And, the pancakes are flawlessly fluffy. I got the cappuccino to wash it sown (ahem, both times I've been). The staff are also very sweet and attentive. I've been on a Sunday each time and despite the full house of customers, I haven't had to wait for a spot to sit.

photos.caption: Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore

Te02BNVAubXYG5PHvKcYKQ.text: Enjoyed Sea Salt Spiced Chai Latte and Cereal Bacon Rolls. Both delicious. Nice atmosphere and a wonderful breakfast menu served all day.

photos.caption: Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore

5uKdZCBUPfmU4wHMUDywhg.text: Excellent baked egg royale, brioche was awesome with Wasabi cream cheese. Highly recommend

photos.caption: Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore

3Q5PZwWFjLsdMmqWHQbAaA.text: This little coffee shop was a great escape from the heat. The interior reminded me of coffee shops that you find in the Northwest. I got the affogato (ice cream with espresso). Both the coffee & ice cream were of superior quality making it a wonderful afternoon snack on a hot day.

photos.caption: Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. Interior of the front counter
Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. Affogato

nKe20YXXiHjonQHI1N90Tw.text: The ambience is fabulous and the decor is hip! A great hangout for youngsters for sure. Love the cakes, latte and cappuccino and the service is impeccable!  The price is slightly steep. I would really love to hangout here if parking is easier.

photos.caption: Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. Attractive frontage

ciFgIbVZfOxLJGe6AMhF1A.text: After the giant surge of cafes opening up in Singapore in the past 2 years, I confess I have been biased against cafe food, because they tend to be a standard cookie-cutter menu in some sort of hipster backdrop.We came here on a public holiday for lunch, and waited about 10 minutes for a place for two, inside. We ordered an ice blended chocolate, an ice blended coffee, strawberry cream cheese pancakes, and bratwurst on a rosti. Oh man, I do love the food here. The food here didn't take too long, and the drinks were decent and not overly sweet, and they do ask if you want whipped cream on or off your ice blended drinks. The cream cheese pancakes are two giant fluffy pancakes with A LOT of cream cheese custard filled in between the two, and strawberry sauce drizzled all over. I am glad we got a savory other dish, because we were sugar-overloaded, but happy nonetheless. The crispy rosti really deserves a special mention, with two bratwursts, a fried sunny-side-up, and sour cream. Would be even better with green scallions on top, but this is as good as it gets!I would come back. Again and again.Oh, and free wifi.

photos.caption: Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. Rosti, egg, bratwurst.

TDxs_KlYfJI3oG2ugipfkA.text: I am so happy that we found Tolido's Espresso Nook.  The place is cute as a button, trendy, comfortable and friendly.  The coffee is on point - the staff is awesome, and the breakfast we had was excellent.  We really enjoyed the vibe - and the laid back atmosphere.  Just what the Dr. ordered while on vacation.Don't delay - go today!

LuCKyCfjsydQ8Frvbnr1Ww.text: I had a flat white and was very pleased they used Yahava beans. The coffee was great, second only to Yahava. The barista was also very friendly, taking the time to explain what a kopi latte was and recommend some choice picks at the cafe. Apparently, the barista came in third at a Singapore latte art competition. As we were stuffed, we did not order any food but we saw many orders for the pandan pancake which looked sumptuous. We'll be back to try that. The place was doing a roaring trade on a Sunday afternoon.

photos.caption: Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore

-sLNzlHwLfPYmDxcbxpZFg.text: Finally, a delicious brunch spot in Singapore that doesn't charge an arm and a leg for a decent meal. Located at an HDB block about an 8 minute walk from both Lavender and Bugis MRT stops, Tolido provides fantastic all day breakfast items along with a robust pasta menu. With most menu items priced between S$10-15, I left the cafe feeling full and satisfied. They also take reservations over the phone, which makes getting a coveted spot indoors very feasible. Will definitely be coming back again to try some of the other items on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore. The nook!
Photo of Tolido's Espresso Nook - Singapore, Singapore

1Yr2MykzBiFfpzgliLWZ1A.text: Very good breakfast with reasonable prices. We had the bacon and eggs, croissant, banana almond French toast and waffle jammer. Americano coffee with one shot was more like coffee in the states.

qGql3_UUh5dD4sgJcnq4bQ.text: The go to place in Singapore. Awesome food and coffee. Its a small place so if you have a big party better make a reservation. You won't regret it.
